body.p: If blood volume were to fall, any associated drop in blood pressure would be detected by baroreceptors. What is the role of baroreceptors in the feedback loop?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The variable is being monitored by the baroreceptors.
Correct. Baroreceptors monitor blood pressure in the aorta and carotid arteries.
Incorrect. Incorrect. The baroreceptors measure a variable, they do not decide if the variable is at an appropriate value.
Incorrect. Effectors would execute the necessary changes in the body.

part.hint: Baroreceptors are located in the blood vessels found just distal to the heart, and their role is included in their name.

body.p: As the blood volume and blood pressure fall, what is the role of the cardiovascular center and vasomotor center in the feedback loop?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Blood pressure is the variable being monitored and controlled.
Incorrect. The receptors detect the blood pressure change, even though some are located in the hypothalamus.
Correct. Both of these parts of the brainstem will determine the changes that are needed to compensate for the change in blood volume to maintain blood pressure homeostasis.
Incorrect. Effectors would execute the necessary changes in the body.

part.hint: These centers are different parts of the hypothalamus that are involved in same role in this feedback loop.

body.p: As the blood volume and blood pressure fall, what would be the effector(s) in this feedback loop?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The cardiovascular and vasomotor centers are the control centers that stimulate the effectors.
Not quite. The heart would be an effector in this feedback loop, but something else will also be involved.
Not quite. The blood vessels would be effectors, but something else will also be involved.
Correct. The heart rate will increase and the blood vessels will constrict.

body.p: What would be the result of the action of the effectors in this feedback loop?

response.feedback: Correct. Increased heart rate and constricted blood vessels will compensate for decreased blood volume by increasing blood pressure.
Incorrect. The heart rate and blood vessel diameter can’t change the blood volume; the kidney would have to be an effector in a different feedback loop to change the blood volume.
Incorrect. A decrease in blood pressure would not correct for the blood volume drop, since blood pressure has also fallen.
Incorrect. The heart rate and blood vessel diameter can’t change the blood volume; the kidney would have to be an effector in a different feedback loop to change the blood volume.
